result.execSummary:
The defendant John Derrick Carson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Derrick Carson Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for John Derrick Carson Jr
Current: 5812 N. 35th St., Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States  (Effective: 08-30-2016)
Prior: 4743 North 39th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $350.00 entered as ordered by the court on 04/29/2016  to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 01/03/2017. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and forwarded to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant John Derrick Carson in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John Derrick Carson in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation.  Defendant advised court he wants to proceed without counsel.  Defendant examined as to request.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to counsel and is competent to proceed without counsel.  Case passed to allow the defendant time to speak with the ADA.

CASE RECALLED.  SAME APPEARANCES
CD#09:47

The defendant advised the Court that he'd like counsel appointed to represent him.  Court appoints attorney Joel Mogren who is present in court and accepts the appointment.  The defendant will repay the County at the conclusion of this case at the rate of $50.00 per month.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with any Sentry Foods store.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant John Derrick Carson in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#15-245
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 21.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant John Derrick Carson not in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/8/15 @ 1:30 pm
